title: How to Shuffle Yu‐Gi‐Oh! Cards

steps.headline: Select a deck.
steps.description: This is also the only time you can make deck edits, so be sure to do them before progressing to next step.

steps.headline: Take a single card of your deck and place the card down to make individual rows.
steps.description: Make at anywhere between 5-10 rows. Placing it in your card zones is one of the best places to put it down, because it gives you a set place to put a card down, and easy to repeat.

steps.headline: Place single cards on top of each row until you run out of cards.
steps.description: Be sure to do this quickly, remember you are on a timer in a tournament

steps.headline: Pick up each row and stack them up in any way you like.
steps.description: It does not matter what way you pick them up, or if you place each row on top, or each row on bottom

steps.headline: Hand your opponent your deck so they can cut your deck.
steps.description: If you do not follow this step, it's grounds for an immediate loss or disqualification. To cut means to split your cards in half and place the bottom half on top.

steps.headline: Move your deck to your side of the table.
steps.description: Do not rearrange any more cards or shuffle again, or else your opponent must cut your deck again.

steps.headline: Search and grab cards you are looking for within your Main Deck.
steps.description: After doing this, place the card off to the side, visibly showing your opponent what card you took out.

steps.headline: Turn deck side ways within your hand and pick up half of the deck.
steps.description: Make sure you do this above the table, in your opponents sight

steps.headline: Slide the two halves together gently, and repeat a few times.
steps.description: Let gravity assist you, and make sure the cards slide between each other.

steps.headline: Hand your deck to your opponent to cut.
steps.description: You must do this every single time you shuffle in a match.

steps.headline: Put your searched card in its designated spot.
steps.description: Make sure you follow the card effects that made you look into your deck .

steps.headline: Place the deck back onto your side of the table.
steps.description: Do not rearrange any more cards or shuffle again, or else your opponent must cut your deck again.

steps.headline: Separate your extra deck cards (xyz, synchro, fusion) from your main deck cards that are in your graveyard/banished.
steps.description: You do not want to have those cards in your deck. Worst case scenario is  you need to summon a card and you can not find it.

steps.headline: Place main deck cards back into your deck.
steps.description: also add/remove cards from main deck or extra deck to side deck now this is your only chance during a match.

steps.headline: Repeat the shuffling process you did pre-game to maximize randomness.
steps.description: With this you are ready to proceed to next game of your match.

text: Pre-Game Select a deck. This is also the only time you can make deck edits, so be sure to do them before progressing to next step. Take a single card of your deck and place the card down to make individual rows. Make at anywhere between 5-10 rows. Placing it in your card zones is one of the best places to put it down, because it gives you a set place to put a card down, and easy to repeat. Place single cards on top of each row until you run out of cards. Be sure to do this quickly, remember you are on a timer in a tournament Pick up each row and stack them up in any way you like. It does not matter what way you pick them up, or if you place each row on top, or each row on bottom Hand your opponent your deck so they can cut your deck. If you do not follow this step, it's grounds for an immediate loss or disqualification. To cut means to split your cards in half and place the bottom half on top. Move your deck to your side of the table. Do not rearrange any more cards or shuffle again, or else your opponent must cut your deck again. In-Game Search and grab cards you are looking for within your Main Deck. After doing this, place the card off to the side, visibly showing your opponent what card you took out. Turn deck side ways within your hand and pick up half of the deck. Make sure you do this above the table, in your opponents sight Slide the two halves together gently, and repeat a few times. Let gravity assist you, and make sure the cards slide between each other. Hand your deck to your opponent to cut. You must do this every single time you shuffle in a match. Put your searched card in its designated spot. Make sure you follow the card effects that made you look into your deck . Place the deck back onto your side of the table. Do not rearrange any more cards or shuffle again, or else your opponent must cut your deck again. Post-Game Separate your extra deck cards (xyz, synchro, fusion) from your main deck cards that are in your graveyard/banished. You do not want to have those cards in your deck. Worst case scenario is  you need to summon a card and you can not find it. Place main deck cards back into your deck. also add/remove cards from main deck or extra deck to side deck now this is your only chance during a match. Repeat the shuffling process you did pre-game to maximize randomness. With this you are ready to proceed to next game of your match.
